page.title: 09CUSTOMS
page.content: Both the schools in Kilsby and Crick have a{Harvest Festival.}This is held in the Autumn term and children bring all kinds of fruit and vegetables to thank God for a good harvest. Afterwards the produce is distributed among the old people of the villages. Many years ago people used to cut the corn and wheat with sickles and scythes.Today we have big combine harvesters. These are huge machines which not only cut the corn but thresh and bag the grain as well. All this is done by one man working the machine instead of 3 or 4 men doing different jobs. {May Day}Normally May Day festivities are held on May 1st.The children in school vote for the May Queen,the Herald and the attendants.On the day the Queen is crowned,music is played and everyone dances around the Maypole
